name: The "S" Bible Quiz | Bible Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: We know about the sabbath day, but in Leviticus 25:4 (KJV) there is also a sabbath what?
questions.explanation:
year.

	The Israelites were to work for six years in the fields and then not work during the seventh year. God promised they would have enough food from the sixth year so they would not go hungry during the seventh year.

questions.text: What does Jesus, in John 17:17 (KJV), ask God to do "through Thy truth"?
questions.explanation:
Sanctify them.

	Sanctify means to be set apart. Many Christians believe they are set apart from the rest of the world because they follow God's law and not man's law when the two do not agree.

questions.text: The word sea is mentioned over 300 times in the King James Version. Where is the first mention of sea, (not seas)?
questions.explanation:
Genesis 1:26.

	Genesis 1:26 says, "And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth." This verse means humans are in charge of everything, that it's our job to take care of the planet. The use of "our" in this verse, many Christians believe, is referring to the Trinity.

questions.text: What are the people "speaking lies in hypocrisy" having done to their "conscience with a hot iron" in 1 Timothy?
questions.explanation:
seared.

	This can be found in 1 Timothy 4:2 (KJV). When we gossip we are speaking in hypocrisy. We also speak lies in hypocrisy when we say one thing and do the other.

questions.text: Mary Magdalene in John 20 (KJV) looked into something and saw it was empty. What "S" word, meaning a cave that is used as a tomb, did she look into?
questions.explanation:
sepulchre.

	Mary was the first person to discover Jesus had risen from the dead just as he said he would. She thought at first someone stole his body, but John's Gospel says two angels let her know Jesus was alive.

questions.text: Who was one of the sons of Hothan?
questions.explanation:
Shama.

	His brother was Jehiel. This can be found in 1 Chronicles 11:44 (KJV). Shama means "to hear".

questions.text: Who slew the Philistines with an ox goad according to Judges 3:31 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Shamgar.

	Shamgar was the song of Anath. In Bible times people usually didn't have a last name they were called the "son of NAME OF FATHER".

questions.text: Which of these men was one of David's sons?
questions.explanation:
Shobab.

	It says that he was born in Jerusalem (I Samuel 5:14). His mother was Bathsheba. His name means rebellious. He was born approximately 1046 BC.

questions.text: According to Genesis 36:23, who was the father of Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam?
questions.explanation:
Shobal.

	Shobal's father was Seir the Horite. Shobal means "path" and it also means "ear of corn".

questions.text: Complete the verse from 1 John 4:10: "Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our _______." What word goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
sins.

	Propitiation means the act of appeasing God. By sending His Son to die many Christians believe if we accept the gift of salvation our sins are washed away and we can someday go to Heaven.
